speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: SCENE III. London. Before the Tower.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER, with his Serving-men in blue coats

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I am come to survey the Tower this day:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Since Henry's death, I fear, there is conveyance.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Where be these warders, that they wait not here?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Open the gates; 'tis Gloucester that calls.

speaker: First Warder
text_entry: [Within]  Who's there that knocks so imperiously?

speaker: First Warder
text_entry: First Serving-Man It is the noble Duke of Gloucester.

speaker: Second Warder
text_entry: [Within]  Whoe'er he be, you may not be let in.

speaker: Second Warder
text_entry: First Serving-Man Villains, answer you so the lord protector?

speaker: First Warder
text_entry: [Within]  The Lord protect him! so we answer him:

speaker: First Warder
text_entry: We do no otherwise than we are will'd.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Who willed you? or whose will stands but mine?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: There's none protector of the realm but I.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Break up the gates, I'll be your warrantize.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Shall I be flouted thus by dunghill grooms?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Gloucester's men rush at the Tower Gates, and WOODVILE the Lieutenant speaks within

speaker: WOODVILE
text_entry: What noise is this? what traitors have we here?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Lieutenant, is it you whose voice I hear?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Open the gates; here's Gloucester that would enter.

speaker: WOODVILE
text_entry: Have patience, noble duke; I may not open;

speaker: WOODVILE
text_entry: The Cardinal of Winchester forbids:

speaker: WOODVILE
text_entry: From him I have express commandment

speaker: WOODVILE
text_entry: That thou nor none of thine shall be let in.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Faint-hearted Woodvile, prizest him 'fore me?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Arrogant Winchester, that haughty prelate,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Whom Henry, our late sovereign, ne'er could brook?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou art no friend to God or to the king:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Open the gates, or I'll shut thee out shortly.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Serving-Men Open the gates unto the lord protector,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or we'll burst them open, if that you come not quickly.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter to the Protector at the Tower Gates BISHOP OF WINCHESTER and his men in tawny coats

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: How now, ambitious Humphry! what means this?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Peel'd priest, dost thou command me to be shut out?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: I do, thou most usurping proditor,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And not protector, of the king or realm.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Stand back, thou manifest conspirator,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou that contrivedst to murder our dead lord;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thou that givest whores indulgences to sin:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I'll canvass thee in thy broad cardinal's hat,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: If thou proceed in this thy insolence.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Nay, stand thou back, I will not budge a foot:

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: This be Damascus, be thou cursed Cain,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: To slay thy brother Abel, if thou wilt.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I will not slay thee, but I'll drive thee back:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thy scarlet robes as a child's bearing-cloth

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I'll use to carry thee out of this place.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Do what thou darest; I beard thee to thy face.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What! am I dared and bearded to my face?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Draw, men, for all this privileged place;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Blue coats to tawny coats. Priest, beware your beard,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I mean to tug it and to cuff you soundly:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Under my feet I stamp thy cardinal's hat:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In spite of pope or dignities of church,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here by the cheeks I'll drag thee up and down.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Gloucester, thou wilt answer this before the pope.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Winchester goose, I cry, a rope! a rope!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now beat them hence; why do you let them stay?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Thee I'll chase hence, thou wolf in sheep's array.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Out, tawny coats! out, scarlet hypocrite!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here GLOUCESTER's men beat out BISHOP OF  WINCHESTER's men, and enter in the hurly- burly the Mayor of London and his Officers

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Fie, lords! that you, being supreme magistrates,

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Thus contumeliously should break the peace!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Peace, mayor! thou know'st little of my wrongs:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here's Beaufort, that regards nor God nor king,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hath here distrain'd the Tower to his use.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Here's Gloucester, a foe to citizens,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: One that still motions war and never peace,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: O'ercharging your free purses with large fines,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: That seeks to overthrow religion,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Because he is protector of the realm,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And would have armour here out of the Tower,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: To crown himself king and suppress the prince.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I will not answer thee with words, but blows.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Here they skirmish again

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Naught rests for me in this tumultuous strife

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: But to make open proclamation:

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Come, officer; as loud as e'er thou canst,

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Cry.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: All manner of men assembled here in arms this day

speaker: Officer
text_entry: against God's peace and the king's, we charge and

speaker: Officer
text_entry: command you, in his highness' name, to repair to

speaker: Officer
text_entry: your several dwelling-places; and not to wear,

speaker: Officer
text_entry: handle, or use any sword, weapon, or dagger,

speaker: Officer
text_entry: henceforward, upon pain of death.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Cardinal, I'll be no breaker of the law:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But we shall meet, and break our minds at large.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Gloucester, we will meet; to thy cost, be sure:

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Thy heart-blood I will have for this day's work.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: I'll call for clubs, if you will not away.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: This cardinal's more haughty than the devil.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Mayor, farewell: thou dost but what thou mayst.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: BISHOP

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Abominable Gloucester, guard thy head;

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: For I intend to have it ere long.

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Exeunt, severally, GLOUCESTER and BISHOP OF WINCHESTER with their Serving-men

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: See the coast clear'd, and then we will depart.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Good God, these nobles should such stomachs bear!

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: I myself fight not once in forty year.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Exeunt
